You might try reading the text, Rich. At least I think the information is
there. First, it is not two fuchi, if you are referring to my article on
Ko-Mino fittings, but one fuchi showing the front and back. This fuchi was
originally a kogai and has been re-worked (naoshi) as a fuchi. Unfortunately
the scan of the back didn$B!G(Bt come out clear enough to see the retained
kogai-ish sections.



Gordon



-----Original Message-----
From: alchemyst [mailto:alchemyst@...]
Sent: Friday, October 31, 2003 6:15 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Naoshi fuchi



In the latest To-Ron, there are two fuchi labeled
as "naoshi fuchi". What does "naoshi" mean in this
context? I'm familiar with it from Naginata-naoshi, but
not in reference to fuchi.

Thanks
Rich S
